<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>One way to find out where people’s heads are at is by looking at the top of the App Store rankings. Last year it was Zoom, in February it was Robinhood, and yesterday, with the Colonial pipeline shutdown causing all kinds of havoc, GasBuddy topped the list for the first time ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may not last long. Yesterday evening, the pipeline's operator said it had restarted operations, though it may take a few days for the supply chain to return to normal. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/inflation-rising-economy-weird?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Inflation Is Rising Because the Economy Is Weird
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/inflation-rising-economy-weird" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Inflation illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYwL2luZmxhdGlvbl9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How do you know when your economy is emerging from a pandemic? When goodbye hugs make a comeback and the rate of inflation hits its highest level in almost 13 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US consumer prices <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/u-s-inflation-climbs-in-april-to-the-highest-level-in-13-years-cpi-shows-11620823628?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 4.2%</a> in April from a year ago, up from the 2.6% gain in March and more than economists expected.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s going on? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things are just very <em>weird</em> right now.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Supply chains are broken: </strong></span><span>From chicken wings to diapers to, most recently, gasoline, supply is not meeting demand. Even our local semiconductor store has been cleaned out.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The pandemic is ending: </strong></span><span>35% of the US population is fully vaccinated, and they’re making up for lost time by traveling, buying clothes that aren’t sweatpants, and dining out.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stimulus abounds: </strong></span><span>The government has rained payments on Americans to help them through the last year of high unemployment levels.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which brings us to the question raging among economists.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is this rapid inflation growth temporary? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some officials, like Fed Chair Jerome Powell, think the run-up in prices is directly related to the winding down of the pandemic. They argue that the quirks of the 2021 economy, like the fact that uber-expensive lumber is adding nearly $36,000 to the price of a new home, is mainly what’s driving inflation.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Take used cars, for example. </strong></span><span>Used car prices </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-12/record-surge-in-used-car-prices-is-key-culprit-in-inflation-jump?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 10%</a></span><span> in April and accounted for more than a third of the monthly increase in consumer prices. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, many officials are betting that once the economy irons out the wrinkles, price growth will settle down to more typical levels.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still…“<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-increases-likely-to-prove-transitory-fed-official-says-11620824400?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">I was surprised</a>,” the Fed’s vice chairman Richard Clarida said once he saw the inflation numbers. “This number was well above what I and outside forecasters expected.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The only CPI reading that matters is the next one. Future readings will better help policymakers understand whether inflation is less “transitory” than it appears to be. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/musk-says-tesla-will-suspend-bitcoin-payments-cars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TFW You Realize Bitcoin Uses a Lot of Energy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/13/musk-says-tesla-will-suspend-bitcoin-payments-cars" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="BERLIN, GERMANY DECEMBER 01:  SpaceX owner and Tesla CEO Elon Musk arriv..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDY0L2Vsb25fbXVza19hd2FyZGVkX3dpdGhfYXguanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In February, Tesla shocked the business world when it said it would invest $1.5 billion in bitcoin and made plans to accept bitcoin as payment for its cars.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in a tweet yesterday, CEO Elon Musk said he was <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/12/elon-musk-says-tesla-will-stop-accepting-bitcoin-for-car-purchases.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspending vehicle purchases</a> with bitcoin due to environmental concerns. The cryptocurrency, which had been falling throughout the day, dropped dramatically in the hours following the tweet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Commentators found it odd that Musk, who runs an electric vehicle company with the mission of reducing fossil fuel emissions, wasn’t aware of the <a href="https://hbr.org/2021/05/how-much-energy-does-bitcoin-actually-consume?utm_source=pocket&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=pockethits" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vast amounts of energy</a> used to mine bitcoin when he announced Tesla’s full-on embrace of the crypto. Maybe he was too busy rehearsing for <em>SNL</em>? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Tesla still has more than $1 billion in bitcoin holdings and Musk said he wouldn't sell any more.  </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/bill-ackmans-pershing-square-snaps-6-dominos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Domino’s Is Worth a Lot More Than $5.99
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/bill-ackmans-pershing-square-snaps-6-dominos" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Eating pizza" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=313 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q73Bb4tlFNtJlmagIk/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Eating pizza" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q73Bb4tlFNtJlmagIk/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may put Domino’s in the category of “4am indulgences,” but billionaire investor Bill Ackman deems it one of the “super-durable growth companies.” He announced at the WSJ Future of Everything Festival that his hedge fund, Pershing Square, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pershing-square-holds-nearly-6-of-domino-s-pizza-ackman-tells-wsj-11620829744?mod=hp_lead_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recently acquired</a> a 6% stake in the pizza chain. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ackman said that he’s had his eye on Domino’s for a while, specifically watching how the company does <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-12/ackman-says-he-takes-stake-in-domino-s-pizza-owns-roughly-6?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">its own delivery</a> in the DoorDash-era. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“That is an important competitive advantage in a world where you want to deliver pizza for $7.99. It’s hard to do that with a delivery service taking a massive cut of the proceeds,” Ackman explained.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pershing is known for its investments in profitable food chains, including Restaurant Brands International (the owner of Burger King), McDonald’s, Chipotle, and Starbucks—where Ackman made a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-05/ackman-sells-stake-in-starbucks-after-pershing-makes-73-return?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">venti-sized 73% return</a> in just 19 months.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This pizza party has been rocking for years. Domino’s stock has risen 13% so far in 2021 and 249% in the past five years.</p>

Chairman and Chief Exe..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYxL3NvZnRiYW5rX2Nlb19tYXNheW9zaGlfc28uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tomohiro Ohsumi/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The Japanese conglomerate SoftBank brought in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/12/softbank-joins-top-corporate-earners-with-its-37-billion-vision-fund-profit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$45.8 billion in net income</a> in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2021, the largest annual profit for any Japanese company ever. It’s also more than Berkshire Hathaway’s net income of $42.5 billion last year. Is it time to crown Masayoshi Son the Oracle of Tokyo? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Those who are uberly engaged with the company want to go to the office two-thirds of the time, at least. Those who are least engaged are very comfortable working from home.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-ceo-says-workers-who-want-back-into-the-office-are-the-most-engaged-11620837018?mod=e2tw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">piping hot take</a> about remote work came from none other than the CEO of WeWork, Sandeep Mathrani. It’s not like he has anything riding on the office market…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How the personal computer broke the human body. (<a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/y3dda7/how-the-personal-computer-broke-the-human-body?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vice</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/ark-invest-dumps-virgin-galactic-shares?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Get-Out-Of-Space Race
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some of Virgin Galactic’s biggest boosters are looking for an escape pod.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ark Invest, a firm known for its bets on futuristic companies, has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/12/cathie-woods-space-exploration-etf-arkx-sells-virgin-galactic-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dumped</a> most of its stake in Virgin from its space exploration ETF. And just two months ago, Chamath Palihapitiya, the company's chairman, sold his remaining shares, worth about $213 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virgin Galactic was once Lord of the SPACs. </strong>In 2019, Palihapitya took Richard Branson’s space flight company public in a SPAC deal before they were cool. But the space tourism biz is hard—and the company’s been struggling with technical setbacks and delays. In its most recent earnings report, released this week, it announced its second consecutive quarter of $0 in revenue.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Is it a deeper problem? Luke Colby, an engineer who has consulted for multiple space companies, </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/01/opinion/sunday/virgin-galactic-richard-branson-elon-musk.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> the NYT that Virgin Galactic’s mission is driven by nostalgia for space travel, whereas rivals Blue Origin and SpaceX are “driven by the physics of spaceflight.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Virgin Galactic stock hit an all time high of ~$63 in February. As of Wednesday's close, it had fallen to $16.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew is teaming up with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/484951944;291136565;v?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">H&R Block</a> to give you the facts, the context, and the tips you need to make sure you're prepared for the most complex tax filing season we can all remember.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with just four days to spare before filing day, we’re unveiling a final piece about everyone’s favorite subject: crypto taxes. Because if you sold all your dogecoin before Elon’s <em>SNL </em>appearance, a) great timing but b) prepare to pay some taxes on it.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nInflation Is Rising Because the Economy Is Weird\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/inflation-rising-economy-weird\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Inflation illustration\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYwL2luZmxhdGlvbl9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow do you know when your economy is emerging from a pandemic? When goodbye hugs make a comeback and the rate of inflation hits its highest level in almost 13 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS consumer prices \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/u-s-inflation-climbs-in-april-to-the-highest-level-in-13-years-cpi-shows-11620823628?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 4.2%\u003c/a\u003e in April from a year ago, up from the 2.6% gain in March and more than economists expected.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings are just very \u003cem\u003eweird\u003c/em\u003e right now.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSupply chains are broken: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFrom chicken wings to diapers to, most recently, gasoline, supply is not meeting demand. Even our local semiconductor store has been cleaned out.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe pandemic is ending: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e35% of the US population is fully vaccinated, and they’re making up for lost time by traveling, buying clothes that aren’t sweatpants, and dining out.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStimulus abounds: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe government has rained payments on Americans to help them through the last year of high unemployment levels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich brings us to the question raging among economists.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs this rapid inflation growth temporary? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome officials, like Fed Chair Jerome Powell, think the run-up in prices is directly related to the winding down of the pandemic. They argue that the quirks of the 2021 economy, like the fact that uber-expensive lumber is adding nearly $36,000 to the price of a new home, is mainly what’s driving inflation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTake used cars, for example. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUsed car prices \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-12/record-surge-in-used-car-prices-is-key-culprit-in-inflation-jump?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped 10%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in April and accounted for more than a third of the monthly increase in consumer prices. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo, many officials are betting that once the economy irons out the wrinkles, price growth will settle down to more typical levels.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill…“\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-increases-likely-to-prove-transitory-fed-official-says-11620824400?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eI was surprised\u003c/a\u003e,” the Fed’s vice chairman Richard Clarida said once he saw the inflation numbers. “This number was well above what I and outside forecasters expected.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe only CPI reading that matters is the next one. Future readings will better help policymakers understand whether inflation is less “transitory” than it appears to be. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn February, Tesla shocked the business world when it said it would invest $1.5 billion in bitcoin and made plans to accept bitcoin as payment for its cars.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in a tweet yesterday, CEO Elon Musk said he was \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/12/elon-musk-says-tesla-will-stop-accepting-bitcoin-for-car-purchases.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspending vehicle purchases\u003c/a\u003e with bitcoin due to environmental concerns. The cryptocurrency, which had been falling throughout the day, dropped dramatically in the hours following the tweet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCommentators found it odd that Musk, who runs an electric vehicle company with the mission of reducing fossil fuel emissions, wasn’t aware of the \u003ca href=\"https://hbr.org/2021/05/how-much-energy-does-bitcoin-actually-consume?utm_source=pocket\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=pockethits\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evast amounts of energy\u003c/a\u003e used to mine bitcoin when he announced Tesla’s full-on embrace of the crypto. Maybe he was too busy rehearsing for \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla still has more than $1 billion in bitcoin holdings and Musk said he wouldn't sell any more.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou may put Domino’s in the category of “4am indulgences,” but billionaire investor Bill Ackman deems it one of the “super-durable growth companies.” He announced at the WSJ Future of Everything Festival that his hedge fund, Pershing Square, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pershing-square-holds-nearly-6-of-domino-s-pizza-ackman-tells-wsj-11620829744?mod=hp_lead_pos5\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecently acquired\u003c/a\u003e a 6% stake in the pizza chain. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAckman said that he’s had his eye on Domino’s for a while, specifically watching how the company does \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-12/ackman-says-he-takes-stake-in-domino-s-pizza-owns-roughly-6?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eits own delivery\u003c/a\u003e in the DoorDash-era. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“That is an important competitive advantage in a world where you want to deliver pizza for $7.99. It’s hard to do that with a delivery service taking a massive cut of the proceeds,” Ackman explained.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePershing is known for its investments in profitable food chains, including Restaurant Brands International (the owner of Burger King), McDonald’s, Chipotle, and Starbucks—where Ackman made a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-05/ackman-sells-stake-in-starbucks-after-pershing-makes-73-return?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eventi-sized 73% return\u003c/a\u003e in just 19 months.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis pizza party has been rocking for years. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eArk Invest, a firm known for its bets on futuristic companies, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/12/cathie-woods-space-exploration-etf-arkx-sells-virgin-galactic-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" In its most recent earnings report, released this week, it announced its second consecutive quarter of $0 in revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIs it a deeper problem?
